text: It's a weird feeling coming across this now the series is over. I loved The Walking Dead game, even with the mis-steps and issues with Telltale along the way. Seeing Clem go from a little girl to a leader was one of my most satisfying video games experiences. I'll have to go through the whole series again one day.

author: Ricvictors

text:
I agree Clementine was probably the most realistic 'kid' video game character I've ever seen.  Duck was a good character too.  They felt like real kids not some cliche over the top characters like you'd see in a Final Fantasy game.  Pretty impressive that Cel-shaded game characters can evoke such emotion on a person.

Lost Odyssey had some pretty good 'kids' in it too but they could still punch monsters with their fists and cast magic.  Kinda takes you out of the realm of realism.

text: I finished this game yesterday. Since it's a new game please refrain from posting any spoilers. I'll have to wait a bit to gather my thoughts, but it might be a serious contender for my favorite point-and-click adventure ever because of the story and the great cast of characters. Lee and Clementine (best child in a video game ever?) are some of the best characters I've ever seen in a video game. It also shows how important it is to have great voiceï»¿ actors.
